basics.name: Yordanos Mathewos
basics.label: Software Developer | Web Development
basics.summary:
I'm a web application software developer. 
Solution delivery - design, creation and management - is my thing.

Background:
- Full stack web application developer.
- I've worked across all aspects of the development and delivery process.
- Previous small business owner (software consultancy).

Now:
- Specialising in web front-end and JAMstack.
- Focused on solution delivery, team leadership, and developer coaching.
- Building a small-scale, privacy-focused social network to take on Facebook.

Tech Focus: 
- Modern JavaScript, Typescript, Vue.js, CSS/SCSS.
- PHP, MongoDB, WordPress, MySQL, Microsoft .NET/C#.
- Netlify, Miocrosoft Azure (App Services and Storage).

Interests: 
- InfoSec; Password management.
- Usability (UX).
- Sustainable software maintenance.
- Managing modern development tech churn.
- Development learning and coaching.

Ideal work: 
- Team leadership.
- Bridging business and development.
- Product development.
- Product research/prototyping.

What matters at work:
Flexibility and a friendly team. Quality equipment and work environment.

Find me at https://jsnelders.com/

I have a Victorian Working with Children Card (April 2019)

work.summary: Not one to shy away from staring down a giant, I'm working on a 'small' side project of building a privacy-focused social network to take on Facebook. The disruption industry needs some disruption.

highlights: Reported to 2 project owners (researchers).
Coordinated with external stakeholders and project managers.
Responsible managing budget and expenditure tracking, planning, software architecture, status reporting, recruitment, and team management.
Recruited a 3 person development team.
Managed 2 x 6-person student teams for 12 weeks to develop sub-components of the project.
Exited the project before completion and delivery.
Ran 2 tutorials per week for Database Applications course(approx. 50-60 students).
The course covered relational databases (Oracle), MobgoDB and developing a web application with PHP.
Learnt MongoDB for the course.
Performed assignment and exam marking.

work.summary:
Assistant project coordinator for the Work Integrated Learning (WIL) course.
WIL is a program of capstone projects by student teams creating solutions for industry sponsors.
highlights: Supervised 6 project teams (~30 students) per semester.
Provided guidance and coaching toward successful project delivery for each sponsor.
Guest lectured on the topic "Getting Started with Git and GitFlow" with a 45 minute practical demonstration for students.

work.summary:
Vylesk was a boutique software development consultancy that built web applications and portals for small businesses and educational institutions.

In 2019 we successfully launched a new Intranet for St Hildas College in Melbourne, designed from scratch with custom workflows and built on top of WordPress. We also developed and managed a custom student tutorial management system for Hildas for 6 years.

Vylesk consisted of 2 principal consultants in Melbourne and 2 full-time developers in India.

Due to declining business a shifting in the industry, in November 2019 we chose to wind down the company to reassess and pursue new opportunities.
highlights: Technologies & Tools: WordPress (theme and plug-in development), PHP, MySQL, jQuery, web application development with HTML/CSS/JavaScript/TypeScript/SASS, VueJS, Bootstrap, W3CSS, .NET/ASP.NET, Microsoft Azure

work.summary: Datacom is a mid-tear corporate consultancy. I left the permanent full-time position in September 2018 to work for myself.
highlights: Senior Developer (full-stack web/.NET) and Team Lead for automated development environment project with Australian Unity.
Interim Technical Lead and ongoing Operations Lead for COBOL migration project with Bupa.
Senior full-stack web/.NET developer on the Organ Match project with Australian Red Cross Blood Service.
Worked with client business stakeholders and internal software teams to deliver requirements.
Created technical and process documentation.
Supported other team leads and assisted junior developers.
Designed and developed an orchestration tool that manages AWS environment creation and automated the setup/linking of corresponding environments in Octopus Deploy.

Technologies & Tools: Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS), Visual Studio 2015 & 2017, Angular 1.2 & 5, .NET 4.6, ASP.NET MVC 4.x, NUnit/Moq, AutoMapper, Entity Framework, SQL Server, Amazon Web Services (AWS) EC2 & CloudFormation, Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, Micro Focus Visual COBOL.

work.summary: Sub-Contract for Object Consulting. Belong was an Australian broadband provider and a division of Telstra.
highlights: Front-end web developer. New feature development, defect resolution, and BAU development.
A/B test development and management of website optimisation campaigns.
Team support and mentor to incoming developers.
Technologies & Tools: Adobe Target, Optimizely, Grunt, Middleman, SASS/CSS, JavaScript, Knockout.js.

work.summary: Short contract role. Full-stack software developer (.NET/web).
Short contract role. Full-stack software developer (.NET/web).
Short contract role. Full-stack software developer (.NET/web).
Sub-contract role for Zenith Solutions (Aust) Pty Ltd. Data migration analyst.
Contract role. Front-end ASP.NET web developer.
Contract role. Full-stack software developer (.NET/web/Access database applications/SQL Server).
Permanent full-time role. Full-stack software developer (.NET/web/VBA/Access database applications/SQL Server).
Permanent full-time role. Full-stack developer (Classic ASP/.NET/web/VBA/Access database applications/SQL Server).

projects.name: 'Connect': A platform for portals and business process automation
projects.description: 'Connect' is a web application layer built on top of WordPress for creating portals/intranets and business process automation. Developed for a a customer and running live since February 2019, every feature is driven by real-world needs. It is designed for extensibility and customisation.  The client since cancelled the project half-way through, but we were successfully running live for 6 months and have since dissected and started re-working the project to be launched as a special service offering in the future.
